summary: A letter from the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center's Legal Department, providing the password for a CD containing discovery materials related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signatory of the letter providing the password for discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being transmitted.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution of Maxwell, as indicated by the case reference and the transmission of discovery materials.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery Materials Password
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends the password for a CD containing discovery materials pertinent to the Ghislaine Maxwell case to the detention center's legal department.

locations: The Sihdol Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
MDCâ€”Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms the transmission of discovery materials on a CD, secured with a password, to the detention center where Maxwell was held.
Audrey Strauss was the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York as of October 29, 2020.
The document illustrates procedural aspects of evidence handling in a high-profile federal prosecution.
